    def get_table_data(page: None):
        # 1. Find all tables on the page
        # Using the MUI specific class found in your inspect element
        tables = page.locator("table.MuiTable-root:visible")
        tables.first.locator("tbody tr").first.wait_for(state="visible")
        table_count = tables.count()
        print(f"Found {table_count} tables.")
    
        for i in range(table_count):
            # Re-locate the table by index to avoid stale element issues after navigation/reloads
            current_table = tables.nth(i)
    
            # 2. Find the first data row (skipping the header)
            # In MUI, rows are usually inside <tbody>
            first_row = current_table.locator("tbody tr").first
    
            # 3. Target the 2nd column (DDRs column)
            # .nth(1) is the second cell (0-indexed)
            drill_down_link = first_row.locator("td").nth(1)
    
            # Extract name before clicking for logging
            link_text = drill_down_link.inner_text()
            print(f"Drilling down into: {link_text}")
    
            # 4. Click the element to drill down
            drill_down_link.click()
    
            # Wait for the table/dashboard to load after click
            # Adjust the selector below to something that appears only in the drilled-down view
